<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: is there a way to skip the first entry in an iterator?: :I have some java code that takes a html table and turns it into an Iterator that I use a while loop to parse and add to a database.  My problem is the header of the table is causing me problems while I am going through my while look(since its not passing my data quality checks).  Is there a way to skip the first row?  Iterator HoldingsTableRows = HoldingsTableRows.iterator();    while (HoldingsTableRows.hasNext()) {}I could get the contents of a variable and if it matches I can break out of the loop but I'm trying to avoid hard coding anything specific to the header names because if the names of the headers change it would break my app.please help!Thanks!
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: is there a way to skip the first entry in an iterator?: :I have some java code that takes a html table and turns it into an Iterator that I use a while loop to parse and add to a database.  My problem is the header of the table is causing me problems while I am going through my while look(since its not passing my data quality checks).  Is there a way to skip the first row?  Iterator HoldingsTableRows = HoldingsTableRows.iterator();    while (HoldingsTableRows.hasNext()) {}I could get the contents of a variable and if it matches I can break out of the loop but I'm trying to avoid hard coding anything specific to the header names because if the names of the headers change it would break my app.please help!Thanks!
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: <<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: HoldingsTableRows.next()
<<<explanation>>>: This method returns the next element in the iterator and advances the cursor position.

```java
Iterator<Row> HoldingsTableRows = table.iterator();
HoldingsTableRows.next(); // This will skip the first row
while (HoldingsTableRows.hasNext()) {
    Row row = HoldingsTableRows.next();
    // Your code to parse and add to database goes here
}
```

This code will skip the first row of the iterator. The `next()` method is called twice in the while loop, once to advance the cursor and once to get the next row.

Please note that this will not affect the iteration count, so the while loop will still iterate over all the remaining rows.

Also, if you are using Java 8 or later, you can use the for-each loop which is more readable and less prone to errors:

```java
for (Iterator<Row> iter = table.iterator(); iter.hasNext(); ) {
    Row row = iter.next();
    // Your code to parse and add to database goes here
}
```

This code does the same thing as the previous one, but it's more concise and easier to read.
